kWL

Class Checking

  • java.lang.Object
    • kWL.Checking

  • public class Checking
extends java.lang.Object
    Checking is basically a class that holds several method that served to test the invariant data generated by the method genearateInvariants() (in the class 'kWLClass'). The 2 methods that each test the invariant data in its own way are checkForCollisions() and checkForCollisions2().

    • Method Detail

      • checkForCollisions

        public static void checkForCollisions(int startOrder,
                                      int maxOrder)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method utilizes the invariant data (\Invariants\). The method loops over the interval of the group order [startOrder, maxOrder] given by their respective arguments, for each order it goes through every group of such order, gets the file size and the crc32 hash of the group's files (3 for each round). Then an ArrayListOfData instance is created for each group that holds the group id along with the file size and hash information. They are then sorted using a convenient compareTo method (defined in the class's source file). By using such a method, we ensure that if 2 groups have the same invariant data, their respective ArrayListOfData instances will be adjacent to each other after sorting. Finally, we check for equality between every 2 adjacent ArrayListOfData instances and print the group ids if we find a pair. This was the method that was used to find all the collisions for order 128, and some of those for order 256.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • checkForCollisions2

        public static void checkForCollisions2(int startOrder,
                                       int maxOrder)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This method works pretty much mostly the same as checkForCollisions(), it works its way through the subfolder for the invariant data of each order in the interval [startOrder, maxOrder], for each group it reads all the files and casts them to the correct class. A GroupInvariant instance is created for each group. They are sorted using a convenient comparison function such that if 2 groups have the same invariant data, their respective GroupInvariant instances will be adjacent after sorting, and when comparing them they will be equal. We check for equality for every 2 adjacent ArrayListOfData and print the group ids.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • checksumBufferedInputStream

        public static long checksumBufferedInputStream(java.lang.String filePath)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Computes a crc32 hash from a file given as a path: the string argument filePath. This one used the BufferedInputStream class and thus should (always?) be preferred.
        Parameters:
        filePath - a string that is the path to the file that is to be hashed
        Returns:
        long crc32 hash of the file in 'filePath'
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • checksumInputStream

        public static long checksumInputStream(java.lang.String filePath)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Computes a crc32 hash from a file given as a path: the string argument filePath. Method is unused and will likely remain so.
        Parameters:

      • checksumMappedFile

        public static long checksumMappedFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Computes a crc32 hash from a file given as a path: the string argument filePath. This one used the FileChannel and MappedByteBuffer classes to read the file. Method is unused and will likely remain so.
        Parameters:
        filePath - a string that is the path to the file that is to be hashed
        Returns:
        long crc32 hash of the file in 'filePath'
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • checksumRandomAccessFile

        public static long checksumRandomAccessFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Computes a crc32 hash from a file given as a path (the string argument filePath). This one uses the RandomAccessFile class to read the file. Method is unused and will likely remain so.
        Parameters:
        filePath - a string that is the path to the file that is to be hashed
        Returns:
        long crc32 hash of the file in 'filePath'
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
